name: Valeriana
Relationship: Compare: ASAF.; IGN.; CROC.; CASTOR.; AMM. VALER. (in neuralgia, gastric disturbance and great nervous agitation). Insomnia especially during pregnancy and menopause. Feeble, hysterical nervous patients.

Head: Pressure in forehead
Sensation of great coldness
Feeling of intoxication
Fever: Long lasting heat, often with sweat on face
Stomach: Heartburn with gulping of rancid fluid
Child vomits curdled milk in large lumps after nursing
Mind: Feels light, as if floating in air
Abdomen: Thin, watery diarrhoea, with lumps of coagulated milk, with violent screaming in children
Spasms in bowels after food and at night in bed
Respiratory: Spasmodic asthma; convulsive movements of the diaphragm
Sleep: Sleepless, with nightly itching and muscular spasms
Throat: Sensation as if a thread were hanging down throat
Extremities: Sciatica; pain worse standing and resting on floor ; better walking
Ears: Earache from exposure to drafts and cold

details: Hysteria, over-sensitiveness, nervous affections, when apparently well-chosen remedies fail. Hysterical spasms and affections generally. HYSTERICAL FLATULENCY.
